MAVIS now fully supports the iPhone 6s, iPhone 6s Plus and iOS 9. This update includes a number of new features and stability improvements.

Full support for the iPhone 6s and 6s Plus
- 4K (UHD) with audio*
- 4K (4:3) without audio - record at maximum camera resolution*
- 120fps at 1080p*

New features
- Timestamp file names by default
- False colour now supports Ranges with full details about colour representations

Stability improvements
- Fixes a problem where user presets were not saved
- Fixes a problem where app crashes on launch
- Recovery of recordings that were not properly stopped
- Improved File manager



*Device restrictions apply
- 4K (UHD) with audio available on iPhone 6s and 6s Plus
- 4K (4:3) without audio available on iPhone 6, 6 Plus, 6s and 6s Plus
- 120fps at 1080p available on iPhone 6s and 6s Plus

This update includes a completely redesigned audio engine, hardware support for DOF adaptors and 100Mbit/s recordings*. It also includes other new features and stability improvements.

New features:
- Custom external audio inputs
- Select external audio input from lighting connector or analogue input
- Manual audio gain control where available*
- Real-time audio passthrough for monitoring in headphones
- External audio input can be monitored with VU meter
- 100 Mbit/s recordings*
- Image flip support for DOF adaptors
- Battery life indicator
- Memory usage indicator

*Device restrictions apply
- 100Mbit/s available on iPhone 6s, 6s Plus and iPhone SE
- Manual audio gain control for internal microphone limited to iPhone 5s, iPhone 6/6 Plus
- Gain control of external sources limited by the external hardware
- App interface language: English

See website for full details - shootmavis.com/specs

This update includes support for iOS 10 and a completely overhauled viewfinder with new pro level features. Frame your shots correctly with our new viewfinder aspects and guides engine - this includes support for cinematic aspects such as 1.85:1 and 2.39:1 and custom guides. Make sure your shots are in focus and not over exposed with support for zebras and expanded focus.

New features:

- Support for iOS 10
- Zebra overlay
- Zebra threshold setting
- Expanded focus
- Redesigned viewfinder settings menu
- Support for different aspect ratios in the viewfinder
- Support for guide overlays including:
- Thirds
- Upper Third
- Portrait Safe
- Custom


**Coming soon - dual camera support for iPhone 7 Plus**

Apple Watch support for record start/stop remote. Performance improvements and bug fixes.

v3.1 Improvements include:

- Better exposure control in low light conditions
- Prevented slow shutter speeds changing frame rate unless activated by user
- Better frame reordering with HEVC
- Prevented h.264 recordings with 4K resolutions and 50/60fps (now HEVC only)
- Fixed bug that caused viewfinder to occasionally freeze
- Fixed bug that caused exposure to change automatically in different light levels
- Fixed bug that caused tally to be behind status bar
- Update to viewfinder and recorder low level threading to improve responsiveness
- Various other bug fixes
